metadata.title: CVE-2020-24502 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Improper input validation in some Intel(R) Ethernet E810 Adapter driversfor Linux before version 1.0.4 and before version 1.4.29.0 for Windows*,may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable a denial of servicevia local access.

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').

linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was not-affected').
linux-gke-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was not-affected').
